subject: AI & Agents
title: The Lighthill Report: Britain Pulls the Plug
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Lighthill Report: Britain Pulls the Plug.

hook.text: In 1973, a single report to British Parliament devastated AI funding across the entire United Kingdom.

buildup.text: James Lighthill reviewed AI research and concluded it had failed to deliver on its grand promises.

discovery.text: He argued the combinatorial explosion made real-world AI problems essentially unsolvable with current methods.

twist.text: Lighthill was largely right about 1970s AI. But his report nearly killed the field in Britain for a generation.

climax.text: British AI researchers scattered to the US and industry. The UK didn't recover its AI lead for decades.

punchline.text: One honest report. One frozen field. Decades of lost potential.

quiz.question: What was the main argument in the Lighthill Report?
options: AI had failed to deliver on promises due to combinatorial explosion
AI was advancing too quickly to be safe
Britain should invest more in AI research
